person.persName: Sterling Alexander Martin Wood (Florence, Alabama, lawyer, politician, and soldier)

body.p: Florence, Alabama, lawyer, politician, and soldier. Florence native. Married to Lelia E. Leftwich Wood on April 10, 1849. Father of William J. Wood, Rosa E. Wood, Lilla E. Wood, Beulah H. Wood, Lelia E. Wood, and S. A. M. Wood. Graduated from St. Joseph’s College in Bardstown, Kentucky in 1841. Lawyer in Florence in 1850 and 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Florence in 1860. Served as solicitor of Alabama’s fourth judicial circuit from 1851 to 1857. Served in the Alabama state legislature from 1857 to 1860. Editor of the Florence Gazette newspaper in 1860. Served in the 7th Alabama Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as captain and colonel from April 3, 1861 to January 1862. Served as brigadier general in the Confederate Army from January 7, 1862 to October 17. 1863.
